00137 /****************************************************************************
00138  * Public function implementations
00139  ****************************************************************************/
00140 int
00141 arrow_problem_read(char *file_name, arrow_problem *problem)
00142 {   
00143     int ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00144     
00145     if(is_symmetric(file_name))
00146         ret = read_stsp(file_name, problem);
00147     else if(is_asymmetric(file_name))
00148         ret = read_atsp(file_name, problem);
00149     
00150     if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE)
00151     {
00152         arrow_print_error("Unable to read '%s'", file_name);
00153         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00154     }
00155         
00156     /* We're going to build a problem name from the file name. */
00157     /* Start by only considering stuff after the last "/" */
00158     char *s = strrchr(file_name, '/');
00159     if(s != NULL)
00160         sprintf(problem->name, "%s", s + 1);
00161     else
00162         sprintf(problem->name, "%s", file_name);
00163         
00164     /* Now replace "." characters with "_" characters */
00165     s = strchr(problem->name, '.');
00166     while(s != NULL)
00167     {
00168         *s = '_';
00169         s = strchr(problem->name, '.');
00170     }
00171         
00172     return ret;
00173 }
00174 
00175 void
00176 arrow_problem_destruct(arrow_problem *problem)
00177 {
00178     if(problem->data != NULL)
00179     {
00180         problem->destruct(problem);
00181         problem->data = NULL;
00182     }
00183 }
00184 
00185 int
00186 arrow_problem_info_get(arrow_problem *problem, int create_hash,
00187                        arrow_problem_info *info)
00188 {
00189     arrow_bintree tree;
00190     int ret;
00191     int i, j;
00192     int cost, min_cost, max_cost;
00193     
00194     ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00195     arrow_bintree_init(&tree);
00196     min_cost = INT_MAX;
00197     max_cost = INT_MIN;
00198         
00199     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00200     {
00201         j = (problem->symmetric == ARROW_TRUE ? i + 1 : 0);
00202         for(; j < problem->size; j++)
00203         {
00204             if(i != j)
00205             {
00206                 /* Add to binary tree */
00207                 cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00208                 ret = arrow_bintree_insert(&tree, cost);
00209                 if(ret != ARROW_SUCCESS) goto CLEANUP;
00210             
00211                 /* Determine min and max costs */
00212                 if(cost < min_cost) min_cost = cost;
00213                 if(cost > max_cost) max_cost = cost;
00214             }
00215         }
00216     }
00217     
00218     /* Convert tree to array */
00219     arrow_bintree_to_new_array(&tree, &(info->cost_list));
00220     info->cost_list_length = tree.size;
00221     info->min_cost = min_cost;
00222     info->max_cost = max_cost;
00223     
00224     /* (optionally) create hash table */
00225     info->hash.num_keys = 0;
00226     if(create_hash)
00227     {
00228         arrow_hash_cost_list(info->cost_list, info->cost_list_length, 
00229                              &(info->hash));
00230     }
00231     
00232 CLEANUP:
00233     arrow_bintree_destruct(&tree);
00234     return ret;
00235 }
00236 
00237 void
00238 arrow_problem_info_destruct(arrow_problem_info *info)
00239 {
00240     if(info->cost_list != NULL)
00241         free(info->cost_list);
00242     if(info->hash.num_keys > 0)
00243         arrow_hash_destruct(&(info->hash));
00244 }
00245 
00246 int
00247 arrow_problem_info_cost_index(arrow_problem_info *info, int cost, int *pos)
00248 {
00249     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00250     
00251     *pos = -1;
00252     if(info->hash.num_keys > 0)
00253     {
00254         *pos = (int)arrow_hash_search(&(info->hash), cost);
00255         if(*pos < 0)
00256             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00257     }
00258     else
00259     {
00260         if(!arrow_util_binary_search(info->cost_list, info->cost_list_length, 
00261                                      cost, pos))
00262         {
00263             arrow_print_error("Could not find cost in cost list");
00264             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00265         }
00266     }
00267     
00268     return ret;
00269 }
00270 
00271 int
00272 arrow_problem_max_cost(arrow_problem *problem)
00273 {
00274     int i, j;
00275     int cost;
00276     int max_cost = INT_MIN;
00277     
00278     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00279     {
00280         j = (problem->symmetric == ARROW_TRUE ? i + 1 : 0);
00281         for(; j < problem->size; j++)
00282         {
00283             if(i != j)
00284             {
00285                 cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00286                 if(cost > max_cost) max_cost = cost;
00287             }
00288         }
00289     }
00290     
00291     return max_cost;
00292 }
00293 
00294 void
00295 arrow_problem_print(arrow_problem *problem, int pretty)
00296 {
00297     int i, j, k, count;
00298     int group_size = 8;
00299     
00300     printf("Problem Cost Matrix:\n");
00301     printf("----------------------------------------");
00302     printf("--------------------------------------\n");
00303     printf("Problem Size:  %d\n", problem->size);
00304     printf("Shallow Data?: %s\n", (problem->shallow ? "Yes" : "No"));
00305     printf("Symmetric?:    %s\n", (problem->symmetric ? "Yes" : "No"));
00306     
00307     /* Print cost matrix out into groups so they will (normally) fit into
00308      * an 80-character width terminal. */
00309     if(pretty)
00310     {
00311         k = 0;
00312         while(k < problem->size)
00313         {
00314             /* Handle special case for last column */
00315             if(problem->size - k < group_size)
00316                 count = problem->size - k;
00317             else
00318                 count = group_size;
00319         
00320             /* Print out the header */
00321             for(j = k; j < k + count; j++)
00322                 printf("\t[j=%d]", j);   
00323             printf("\n");
00324 
00325             /* Print out rows */
00326             for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00327             {
00328                 printf("[i=%d]", i); fflush(stdin);
00329                 for(j = k; j < k + count; j++)
00330                 {
00331                     if(i == j)
00332                         printf("\t-");
00333                     else
00334                         printf("\t%d", problem->get_cost(problem, i, j));
00335                     fflush(stdin);
00336                 }
00337                 printf("\n");
00338             }
00339             printf("\n");
00340 
00341             k += count;
00342         }
00343     }
00344     else
00345     {
00346         /* Print out the header */
00347         for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00348             printf("\t[j=%d]", i);   
00349         printf("\n");
00350         
00351         /* Print out rows */
00352         for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00353         {
00354             printf("[i=%d]", i); fflush(stdin);
00355             for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00356             {
00357                 if(i == j)
00358                     printf("\t-");
00359                 else
00360                     printf("\t%d", problem->get_cost(problem, i, j));
00361                 fflush(stdin);
00362             }
00363             printf("\n");
00364         }
00365         printf("\n");
00366     }
00367 }

00369 int
00370 arrow_problem_read_tour(char *file_name, int size, int *tour)
00371 {
00372     if(CCutil_getcycle_tsplib(size, file_name, tour) == CONCORDE_SUCCESS)
00373         return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00374     else
00375         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00376 }
00377 
00378 int
00379 arrow_problem_abtsp_to_sbtsp(int shallow, arrow_problem *old_problem, 
00380                              int infinity, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00381 {
00382     new_problem->size = old_problem->size * 2;
00383     new_problem->type = ARROW_PROBLEM_ABTSP_TO_SBTSP;
00384     new_problem->shallow = shallow;
00385     new_problem->symmetric = ARROW_TRUE;
00386     new_problem->fixed_edges = old_problem->size;
00387     sprintf(new_problem->name, "%s", old_problem->name);
00388     
00389     abtsp_data *data = NULL;
00390     if((data = malloc(sizeof(abtsp_data))) == NULL)
00391     {
00392         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for abtsp_data");
00393         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00394     }
00395     data->base = old_problem;
00396     data->infinity = infinity;    
00397     new_problem->data = data;
00398 
00399     new_problem->get_cost = abtsp_get_cost;
00400     new_problem->destruct = abtsp_destruct;
00401     
00402     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00403 }
00404 
00405 int
00406 arrow_problem_mstsp_to_btsp(int shallow, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00407                             int max_cost, arrow_problem *new_problem)
00408 {
00409     new_problem->size = old_problem->size;
00410     new_problem->type = ARROW_PROBLEM_MSTSP_TO_BTSP;
00411     new_problem->shallow = shallow;
00412     new_problem->symmetric = old_problem->symmetric;
00413     new_problem->fixed_edges = old_problem->fixed_edges;
00414     sprintf(new_problem->name, "%s", old_problem->name);
00415     
00416     mstsp_data *data = NULL;
00417     if((data = malloc(sizeof(mstsp_data))) == NULL)
00418     {
00419         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for mstsp_data");
00420         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00421     }
00422     data->base = old_problem;
00423     data->max_cost = max_cost;
00424     new_problem->data = data;
00425 
00426     new_problem->get_cost = mstsp_get_cost;
00427     new_problem->destruct = mstsp_destruct;
00428     
00429     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00430 }

00432 
00433 /****************************************************************************
00434  * Private function implementations
00435  ****************************************************************************/
00436 /* These regular expressions check to see if the given file name ends
00437    with tsp (for symmetric TSPLIB files) or atsp (for asymmetric TSPLIB
00438    files).  Someday, perhaps, I'll bother to actually read the TSPLIB
00439    file to see what the TYPE is rather than go by the file extension. */
00440 int
00441 is_symmetric(char *file_name)
00442 {
00443     return arrow_util_regex_match(file_name, "(.*\\.([tT][sS][pP])$)");
00444 }
00445 
00446 int
00447 is_asymmetric(char *file_name)
00448 {
00449     return arrow_util_regex_match(file_name, "(.*\\.([aA][tT][sS][pP])$)");
00450 }
00451 
00452 int
00453 read_stsp(char *file_name, arrow_problem *problem)
00454 {
00455     int size;
00456     CCdatagroup *dat = NULL;
00457     
00458     arrow_debug("Reading symmetric TSPLIB file...\n");
00459 
00460     /* Allocate CCdatargoup structure for Concorde to chew on. */
00461     if((dat = malloc(sizeof(CCdatagroup))) == NULL)
00462     {
00463         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for CCdatagroup");
00464         goto CLEANUP;
00465     }
00466     
00467     /* We're going to use Concorde to read the TSPLIB file!  Sneaky! 
00468        Recall that Concorde returns 1 on failure because it's silly. */
00469     if(CCutil_gettsplib(file_name, &size, dat))
00470     {
00471         arrow_print_error("Unable to read TSPLIB file using Concorde\n");
00472         goto CLEANUP;
00473     }
00474     
00475     problem->size = size;
00476     problem->type = ARROW_PROBLEM_DATA_CONCORDE;
00477     problem->symmetric = ARROW_TRUE;
00478     problem->fixed_edges = 0;
00479     problem->data = (void *)dat;
00480     problem->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00481     problem->get_cost = concorde_get_cost;
00482     problem->destruct = concorde_destruct;
00483     
00484     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00485 
00486 CLEANUP:
00487     if(dat != NULL) free(dat);
00488     return ARROW_FAILURE;
00489 }
00490 
00491 int 
00492 concorde_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j)
00493 {
00494     CCdatagroup *dat = (CCdatagroup *)problem->data;    
00495     return dat->edgelen(i, j, dat);
00496 }
00497 
00498 void
00499 concorde_destruct(arrow_problem *problem)
00500 {    
00501     if(problem->data != NULL)
00502     {
00503         CCdatagroup *dat = (CCdatagroup *)problem->data;
00504         CCutil_freedatagroup(dat);
00505     }
00506 }
00507 
00508 int
00509 read_atsp(char *file_name, arrow_problem *problem)
00510 {
00511     int size = -1;
00512     full_matrix_data *data;
00513     
00514     arrow_debug("Reading asymmetric TSPLIB file...\n");
00515     
00516     /* Allocate CCdatargoup structure for Concorde to chew on. */
00517     if((data = malloc(sizeof(full_matrix_data))) == NULL)
00518     {
00519         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for full_matrix_data");
00520         goto CLEANUP;
00521     }
00522     data->adj = NULL;
00523     data->adjspace = NULL;
00524 
00525     /* This code is mostly borrowed (stolen?) from Concorde's routine,
00526        so credit to the Concorde guys who dealing with the pain of reading
00527        TSPLIB files in C. */
00528     char buf[256], key[256], field[256];
00529     char *p;
00530     FILE *in;
00531     int norm, i, j;
00532     
00533     if(!(in = fopen(file_name, "r"))) 
00534     {
00535         arrow_print_error("Unable to open file for input\n");
00536         goto CLEANUP;
00537     }
00538     
00539     while(fgets(buf, 254, in) != (char *)NULL)
00540     {
00541         p = buf;
00542         while (*p != '\0')
00543         {
00544             if (*p == ':') *p = ' ';
00545             p++;
00546         }
00547         p = buf;
00548         
00549         if(sscanf(p, "%s", key) != EOF)
00550         {
00551             p += strlen(key);
00552             while(*p == ' ') p++;
00553             
00554             if(!strcmp (key, "NAME"))
00555             {
00556                 arrow_debug("Problem Name: %s", p);
00557             }
00558             else if(!strcmp (key, "TYPE"))
00559             {
00560                 arrow_debug("Problem Type: %s", p);
00561                 if(sscanf(p, "%s", field) == EOF || strcmp (field, "ATSP"))
00562                 {
00563                     arrow_print_error("Not an ATSP problem");
00564                     goto CLEANUP;
00565                 }
00566             } 
00567             else if(!strcmp (key, "COMMENT"))
00568             {
00569                 arrow_debug("%s", p);
00570             } 
00571             else if(!strcmp (key, "DIMENSION"))
00572             {
00573                 if(sscanf(p, "%s", field) == EOF)
00574                 {
00575                     arrow_print_error("ERROR in DIMENSION line");
00576                     goto CLEANUP;
00577                 }
00578                 size = atoi(field);
00579                 arrow_debug("Number of Nodes: %d\n", size);
00580             }
00581             else if(!strcmp (key, "EDGE_WEIGHT_TYPE"))
00582             {
00583                 if(sscanf(p, "%s", field) == EOF)
00584                 {
00585                     arrow_print_error("ERROR in EDGE_WEIGHT_TYPE line");
00586                     goto CLEANUP;
00587                 }
00588                 if(!strcmp(field, "EXPLICIT")) {
00589                     printf ("Explicit Lengths (CC_MATRIXNORM)\n");
00590                     norm = CC_MATRIXNORM;
00591                 }
00592                 else
00593                 {
00594                     arrow_print_error("ERROR: Not set up for given norm");
00595                     goto CLEANUP;
00596                 }
00597             }
00598             else if(!strcmp (key, "EDGE_WEIGHT_FORMAT"))
00599             {
00600                 if(sscanf (p, "%s", field) == EOF)
00601                 {
00602                     arrow_print_error("ERROR in EDGE_WEIGHT_FORMAT line");
00603                     goto CLEANUP;
00604                 }
00605                 if(strcmp(field, "FULL_MATRIX"))
00606                 {
00607                     arrow_print_error("Cannot handle edge weight format");
00608                     goto CLEANUP;
00609                 }
00610             }
00611             else if(!strcmp(key, "EDGE_WEIGHT_SECTION"))
00612             {
00613                 if(size < 1) {
00614                     arrow_print_error("Dimension not specified");
00615                     goto CLEANUP;
00616                 }
00617                 if(data->adj != (int **)NULL)
00618                 {            
00619                     arrow_print_error("A second NODE_COORD_SECTION?");
00620                     goto CLEANUP;
00621                 }
00622                 if ((norm & CC_NORM_SIZE_BITS) == CC_MATRIX_NORM_SIZE)
00623                 {
00624                     data->adj = CC_SAFE_MALLOC(size, int *);
00625                     data->adjspace = CC_SAFE_MALLOC(size * size, int);
00626 
00627                     if(data->adj == (int **) NULL ||
00628                         data->adjspace == (int *) NULL) 
00629                     {
00630                         arrow_print_error("Could not setup adj/adjspace");
00631                         goto CLEANUP;
00632                     }
00633                     
00634                     for(i = 0, j = 0; i < size; i++)
00635                     {
00636                         data->adj[i] = data->adjspace + j;
00637                         j += size;
00638                     }
00639                     
00640                     for(i = 0; i < size; i++)
00641                     {
00642                         for(j = 0; j < size; j++)
00643                         {
00644                             fscanf(in, "%d", &(data->adj[i][j]));
00645                         }
00646                     }
00647                 }
00648             }
00649             else if(!strcmp(key, "NODE_COORD_SECTION"))
00650             {
00651                 arrow_print_error("Encountered NODE_COORD_SECTION\n");
00652                 goto CLEANUP;
00653             }
00654             else if(!strcmp(key, "FIXED_EDGES_SECTION"))
00655             {
00656                 arrow_print_error("Not set up for fixed edges\n");
00657                 goto CLEANUP;
00658             }
00659         }
00660     }
00661 
00662     problem->size = size;
00663     problem->type = ARROW_PROBLEM_DATA_FULL_MATRIX;
00664     problem->symmetric = ARROW_FALSE;
00665     problem->fixed_edges = 0;
00666     problem->data = (void *)data;
00667     problem->shallow = ARROW_FALSE;
00668     problem->get_cost = full_matrix_get_cost;
00669     problem->destruct = full_matrix_destruct;
00670     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00671 
00672 CLEANUP:
00673     if(data->adjspace != NULL) free(data->adjspace);
00674     if(data->adj != NULL) free(data->adj);
00675     return ARROW_FAILURE;
00676 }
00677 
00678 int 
00679 full_matrix_get_cost(arrow_problem *problem, int i, int j)
00680 {
00681     full_matrix_data *data = (full_matrix_data *)problem->data;
00682     return data->adj[i][j];
00683 }
00684 
00685 void
00686 full_matrix_destruct(arrow_problem *problem)
00687 {   
00688     if(problem->data != NULL)
00689     {
00690         full_matrix_data *data = (full_matrix_data *)problem->data;
00691         free(data->adjspace);
00692         free(data->adj);
00693     }
00694 }
00695 
00696 int 
00697 abtsp_get_cost(arrow_problem *this, int i, int j)
00698 {
00699     if(j > i) return abtsp_get_cost(this, j, i);
00700     
00701     abtsp_data *data = (abtsp_data *)this->data;
00702     int n = data->base->size;
00703     
00704     if((i < n) || (j >= n))
00705         return data->infinity;
00706     else if(i == j + n)
00707         return -1 * data->infinity;
00708     else
00709         return data->base->get_cost(data->base, j, i - n);
00710 }
00711 
00712 void 
00713 abtsp_destruct(arrow_problem *this)
00714 { 
00715     free(this->data);
00716 }
00717 
00718 int 
00719 mstsp_get_cost(arrow_problem *this, int i, int j)
00720 {
00721     mstsp_data *data = (mstsp_data *)this->data;
00722     return data->max_cost - data->base->get_cost(data->base, i, j);
00723 }
00724 
00725 void 
00726 mstsp_destruct(arrow_problem *this)
00727 { 
00728     free(this->data);
00729 }
